intro: Bupleurum angulosum f. lancifolium, commonly known as the lance-leaved bupleurum, is a botanical variant characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale yellow. This subspecies is valued for its potential medicinal properties and is of interest in traditional herbal practices.
